data.title: What is NetSuite - and What's its Secret to Helping Customers Grow?
data.meta_description: What is NetSuite and how can it help your business grow? As both a strategic NetSuite partner and customer, we offer a unique perspective.
data.text:
Today’s modern, growing businesses that are looking to add or update their ERP are going to be evaluating cloud-based solutions. NetSuite is an industry-leading cloud-based ERP system for all different business sizes. As a strategic NetSuite partner, we are excited about the growth of NetSuite and have seen firsthand how it can set up companies for success.

What is NetSuite?

Founded in 1998 and commonly referred to as the first American cloud computing company, NetSuite provides software and services to manage business finances, operations, and customer relations. According to their website, NetSuite provides a suite of cloud-based financials / Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) and omni-channel commerce software that runs the business of more than 19,000 customers in more than 200 countries and territories.

NetSuite ERP supports back office operations, which include financial, human resources, procurement, orders, inventory, shipping and billing. Benefits of a cloud solution include being agile and scalable, making it the perfect solution for companies looking for continued growth. Its appeal comes from NetSuite providing a flexible, easy-to-use platform that supports a variety of industries and verticals with a broad range of functionality designed for all users that can be accessed via any device at any time. Typically, NetSuite customers are fast-growing businesses wanting to replace manual data entry, Quickbooks or other business systems and move to the Cloud.

The Secret: Easy Integrations to Meet Every Need

Since cloud software success is based on renewals, making sure the customer is happy is the number one priority. NetSuite achieves that by partnering with cloud-based applications to support and extend their base functionality. You can add on different cloud applications to customize your experience and meet your individual business needs.

Suiteapp.com is NetSuite’s app store where you can download various SuiteApps. SuiteApps are developed on the SuiteCloud Platform by NetSuite and members of the SuiteCloud Developer Network, NetSuite's third-party developer program. While NetSuite is only responsible for their designated SuiteApps, they work closely with their partners to ensure “seamless support between organizations.” For example, customers looking for a WMS can shop solutions like RF-SMART to extend NetSuite's key warehousing, wholesale distribution, manufacturing and retail functionality.

A Partners Perspective on NetSuite

Even technology companies need ERP products to run their businesses. RF-SMART is like many other NetSuite customers. We were using multiple on-premise systems that didn’t talk to one another, creating data silos. NetSuite offered an ERP that met our growing needs. Since going live, we’ve been able to scale and grow our business year over year, including being named one of the 50-Fastest Growing Companies by the Jacksonville Business Journal.

From a product perspective, it made sense to partner with NetSuite to create a supply chain solution to meet their customers’ needs.

“There were three factors that spurred this decision: First, we saw the rise of cloud computing and cloud ERP and knew that was the business model of the future. We needed to move RF-SMART in that direction. Second, as a customer ourselves, we were familiar with NetSuite and were energized by their rapid growth and global expansion. Finally, we needed to make sure we designed a product that worked to fill gaps and add significant value to customers. So far we’ve been able to do that with our NetSuite product,” said Michael Morales, RF-SMART CEO.

We launched our RF-SMART for NetSuite product on Suiteapp.com in October 2013 and in May 2014 were named SuiteApp of the Year at Suiteworld. Receiving this award meant we were recognized for filling a valuable need in the NetSuite ecosystem that met customers’ needs and is in alignment with NetSuite’s cloud vision.

Where Do We See NetSuite in the Future?

In November 2016, NetSuite was acquired by technology giant Oracle Corporation. This alignment has been successful for both brands. According to the Silicon Valley Business Journal, NetSuite has seen growth in the mid-20% range overall, including revenue growth of 32% from June 2018 to May 2019, and the NetSuite acquisition bolstered Oracle’s cloud experience and calmed criticism about Oracle's slow transition to the cloud.

The benefits of cloud-based erp software can no longer be dismissed as a fad. We believe NetSuite is in a strategic position to continue to help companies looking for a Cloud ERP solution streamline processes, lower complexity, gain visibility, reduce costs, and can scale with them as they grow.

So much so, in 2020 we are increasing our product Research and Development by 56% over last year on our RF-SMART for NetSuite software product line. We continue to be excited about the increasing rate of adoption of RF-SMART by the NetSuite ecosystem and we hit the 2,000 NetSuite customer mark in 2023.
